summary: This document is a set of 30-minute check sheets from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Special Housing Unit for the date August 9, 2019. The logs detail scheduled inmate observation rounds for multiple tiers (L-Tier, M-Tier, ZA Tier-J, K, G, H, ZB) and were reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain. The document is significant as it represents the standard operating procedure for monitoring inmates, including high-profile ones like Jeffrey Epstein, on the day before his death.

persons.name: Morning Watch Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer who reviewed the 30-minute check sheets for the Special Housing Unit on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The senior officer who, along with the Lieutenant, reviewed the completed check sheets.

events.title: MCC Special Housing Unit Monitoring
events.description: Continuous 30-minute observational checks of inmates in locked-down status (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) were conducted and documented throughout the day at the MCC New York Special Housing Unit.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a prison log detailing 30-minute observational checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York on August 9, 2019.
The procedure required staff to observe each inmate at least twice per hour, on an irregular schedule, with no more than 40 minutes between checks.
The logs were reviewed and signed off by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.
The document covers multiple tiers within the Special Housing Unit (L-Tier, M-Tier, ZA Tier-J, K, G, H, ZB), indicating a broad monitoring operation.
This type of log is a standard correctional procedure for monitoring high-risk or segregated inmates.
